sixmensmorris

Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • sixmensmorris.AI

  • public class AI
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the AI class for games with a computer/ The AI is implemented in a very basic way. First, for placing stage, the AI will try to place pieces on the center parts of each line to be advantageous Second, for the moving stage, the AI will move the first piece available at a random available direction Third, for removing pieces, the AI will remove the first available pieces
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Zichen Jiang

    • Method Detail

      • updateBoardView

        public void updateBoardView(BoardView boardView)
        gives AI the most up-to-date board view
        Parameters:
        boardView - board view class received from BoardController

      • nextPlace

        public int nextPlace()
        Try to find the next available position to place a piece. Will try the middle points first, then the corner ones.
        Returns:
        the position on the board to place the piece

      • nextRemove

        public int nextRemove()
        Find the next available piece from the player to remove. If only mill exist, remove a piece from the mill. Otherwise remove first piece encountered.
        Returns:
        the position of the piece to remove

      • nextMove

        public int[] nextMove()
        Try to find a piece available to move, and calculate where to move it. Will go through each piece and move the first available one at a random direction.
        Returns:
        [a,b] - a: which piece to move; b: where to put it
